page.title: 09Portsmouth Central Library
page.content: Situated in the Guildhall Square, the{Central Library}is one of the largest libraries south of Birmingham. Opened in 1883 as a reading room, it moved to a new, larger site in 1978. It contains{212,000 books}as well as records, videos, tapes and microforms. There is also a collection of Naval & historical books. Every fortnight the library is given 150 new books. It takes 6 months to get the books ready for public use. The librarians choose the books, shelve and catalogue them, help people and organise children's activities. The library is a busy place and an important service. A wide range of people use it and take out a variety of books, though thrillers and adventure books are most popular. -R.West, S.Stopford, R.Russell and R.Quinnell:Portsmouth High School
